intro: Turpinia nepalensis var. montana, commonly known as the Himalayan turpinia, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Nepal and northern India. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many evergreen and deciduous shrubs adapted to acidic soils. The plant typically grows at elevations between 2,000 and 4,000 meters, where it thrives in cool, moist environments.
